website_summaries.verdict: Rivals standard mowers when it comes to lawn appearance. At a fraction of the price of other models, it's the one to get, especially if you are new to reel mowers or have a small yard.
cons: Handle isn't as durable as other models we considered
Doesn't work well on uneven areas
Adjusting the blade height is difficult

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Cut It
customer_reviews.text: Hate to be the dissenter here, but my experience with this mower was not good at all, and it has been returned. I owned another reel mower years ago, I believe it was a Black & Decker, and it worked great. This one, however, leaves about 15% of the grass untouched, and multiple passes (which one shouldn't have to do) don't return much better results. Per the manual, I checked the cutting blade adjustment using paper, and made a minor adjustment, but there was no improvement. Something about how the grass is introduced into the mower isn't right, it seems. Mind you, this was on a relatively sparse lawn that wasn't high at all, in three different attempts.
customer_reviews.author: American Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not recomended for Zoysia or Bermuda
customer_reviews.text: Received product with broken adjuster knob. Also the description failed to mention Zoysia and Bermuda are not preferred when using this mower, however the instructions in the box mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Like a bad razor
customer_reviews.text: It's harder to move around than a typical electric lawnmower, makes no less noise (though arguably it does make a more 'interesting' noise) and is far less effective at cutting grass. As far as I can tell, like a bad razor blade it will only work if you shave every day. If the grass gets more than a few inches long, forget it. I bought this because my wife was led to believe it was cheaper, quieter and just as effective as a normal electric mower. Pah!
customer_reviews.author: iestyn Bleasdale-Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. My lawn was overgrown pretty bad because my ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. My lawn was overgrown pretty bad because my gas mower broke down. I had to go over it at least 4 times with this manual mower but luckily i have a small lawn. It doesnt look bad but there are spots that get matted down and not cut. I think once I cut it a couple times a week you wont be able to tell the difference between this and a gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy to report that this mower works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it in March when it was still snowing. Finally heard lawn mowing noises outside and quickly got it out. I am very happy to report that this mower works wonderfully. I purchased this for my dad who loves yard work and gets bored easily, and he loves it. We have a gasoline lawn mower and it is loud and can be difficult to control. I hate watching my dad wearing earplugs and have trouble using it when cutting grass so I decided to give this one a try. For people who are retired and hate the noise and mess, like my dad, it is a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Green and mean!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! This green and mean machine has a smooth gliding motion, makes a satisfying tickety-tack sound, and stays pretty sharp. It does a very good job on shorter grass and weeds, not as well once they get about 6 inches tall. I put this together myself ( I am a woman ) in about 30 minutes very easily. I do recommend that you pay CLOSE attention to how the items go together via the instructions, AND, don't tighten the handle pieces down all the way before you get the blade in. That will assist you in getting the blade to move into it's proper position. Then tighten everything well.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase assembles in 10 minutes, if the grass is very high start first with the taller cut and then set it down to the required cut size. When you reach the cut size you want, you must give it several passes to achieve the desired cut. The advantage of this machine compared to gasoline powered mowers is how quiet they are, also having rollers that control the size of the cut guarantee that the cut is uniform throughout the cutting area, this is a great advantage when you compare it with the string lawnmowers which you can loose control of cut size specially if you are not an expert.
customer_reviews.author: Jersep

customer_reviews.title: Defective axle
customer_reviews.text: Axle broken when I loosened the side screws of the roller to adjust cut height as per manual instructions. I'm guessing the axle rod was overscrewed or damaged prior to/during delivery, and the slightest release of tension/compression caused that to happen. Called EarthwiseTools directly and they aren't sure how that could happen either. Super annoying to have to send back to Amazon, wait for confirmation of receipt, then 7 business days for a refund, and then decide if I want a replacement or not.
customer_reviews.author: Sucasa, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Clean Cut - Get a Grass Catcher with this
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to make the necessary adjustments when you receive it, I did the paper test and the mower was not cutting anything out of the box, the reel and the bed knife had to be adjusted. after about 20 minutes of adjustments I was able to get it to cut perectly. I tested this on a newly seeded lawn (30 days) - Perennial Rye Grass and Kentucky Bluegrass mix, around am imch in height. The cut was precise and clean - if you do not have a grass catcher then prepare to rake and clean your clippings. I have a grass catcher on the way to pair with this. Great value for the money for a small lawn.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Freddy D

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well it cut
customer_reviews.text: I watched several videos on adjusting the blades to the bed knife for an even cut across the width of the mower using strips of paper to check the cut. I was impressed that the mower came perfectly adjusted. Parts of my lawn were quite long and I was surprised how well it cut the tall grass although I did go over each swath twice. This mower is easy to push and performs well. Love that it's relatively quiet, needs no gas and generates no pollution. Very happy with my purchase especially because I bought it on sale.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great Push Reel Mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower saves me so much time trimming the yard. My hubby mows with his riding mower and I do the trimming, which is a lot. Carrying around the power trimmer was getting the best of me (I'm 73 years old and 5 foot 2 ). I said that so you would know how easy this mower is to push! There are areas where he can't go with the big mower and I can do it with this mower so easily. There are just a couple of small places were I have to use the power trimmer. This is probably the best purchase I've made this year!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gray

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well...
customer_reviews.text: This mower is extremely light compared to any gas or electric mower. Substantially lighter than both my EGO electric and Toro gas mowers. It’s the only one I trust to use on my front yard which consists of emerald zoysia. It cuts so smoothly, and evenly, I see people in my security cam footage several times weekly stop and stare at the grass, bend over and feel it to find out if it’s real. It does an amazing job. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy it again or recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: chuckntx

customer_reviews.title: Still sharp, 3rd year, cuts grass wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Love this little mower. Cuts grass so much more beautifully than my gas mower. I cut both a half acre lawn and a tenth acre lawn. Be warned that this is not for those who let their grass grow really long. Especially if you have crab grass. If you go beyond 4 or 5 inches, this little guy won't hack it. I'm buying the 18 inch so I won't have to go back and forth between two properties. It takes about an hour and fifteen mins for me to cut 1/2 acre. So quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Raine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together - precision grass trimming.
customer_reviews.text: New grass seed in front yard finally growing - my riding mower tires flatted the new grass - the push gas mower left deep ruts. The Great States 415-16 16-Inch 5-Blade Push Reel Lawn Mower, 16-Inch, 5-Blade, manual push mower nicely trimmed off my new grass without any bad after effects. Easy to clean off cut blades of grass. It was pre set - did not have to adjust the height - but the instructions told how in case necessary. BIG THANK YOU - easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg A. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and Handy Tool for your lawn...
customer_reviews.text: Great little manual lawn mower that cuts cleanly and fairly easily. We have a lawn service but sometimes he delays cutting the lawn and then remembers us and gives the grass too drastic a haircut. This allows me to occasionally do the lawn myself without the hassle of dealing with a gas engine or electric mower. The height adjustment is easy to do and can be done without any tools. Definitely worth the cost and overall quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: DOCAMAZON

customer_reviews.title: Hard to push (for me)
customer_reviews.text: It's harder to push that I thought it would be and it doesn't get close enough to walls and fences. I'm sure it would work better for someone younger with more strength. I just bought it to get up close to the house and fences, but it didn't. It's a good item, but not for me. That's not your fault though. Just overestimated my ability to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail H. Batson

customer_reviews.title: 18" Reel Mower
customer_reviews.text: Solid machine that cuts like a champ...as long as the grass is not damp or overgrown. First 2 uses where on newly planted grass. I had trouble with grass laying down as I passed over and did not cut well. Once I figured out that the grass should not be damp when mowed or taller than a couple of inches I haven't had any issues at all. Will not xut St. Augustine very well. Best used on fescue and rye type lawns. Awesome product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Bargen
customer_reviews.text: I don't write too many reviews, but this product deserves 5-Stars. This is my second reel-push mower, the first being Husqvarna. This one is cheaper, is sturdier, and cuts better than the Husqvarna ever did. This even cuts through unseeded Bermuda and Zoysia like butter even though they warn you that it's not the best grass for this type of mower.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Turner

customer_reviews.title: I bought this along with an electric weed eater cor edging and I couldn't be happier. I have found raking before mowing gives the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new homeowner tired of paying the lawn guy. Self admittedly I'm not a mechanical person and wanted no part of a gas powered mower. I bought this along with an electric weed eater cor edging and I couldn't be happier. I have found raking before mowing gives the best results to avoid getting it getting sticks caught inside the blade. For the price it was exactly what I needed. Make sure to spray blade with silicone lubricant after each use. Also if you wash it with hose use a leaf blower followed by a towel to make sure its dry. I have had no signs of corrison and the mower looks as good as new still.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on night shift and sleeps all day. The only time we can mow is very late afternoon and for anyone who lives in Florida in the summer knows it rains every afternoon. I got this so I can mow without making any noise whenever I want. It works great. It's not effortless to push but it's also not hard. I have no problem at all and it glides over leaves no problem. They are right it won't cut tall weeds. But if I go over before they get too tall it cuts them and keeps them from growing. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: Who thought mowing would be fun?
customer_reviews.text: I have never mowed a lawn before, and this little mower makes it fun! It's so easy to maneuver, and that's saying something because my yard (acre) is full of gopher holes, dog holes, twigs, leaves, you name it. A stick will get stuck occasionally, but for the most part, this thing is a breeze and a pleasure! It satisfies my exercise, outdoor, and OCD needs!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small lawns!
customer_reviews.text: To cut a small lawn, this is perfect! Blades are sharp and they rotate smoothly. As stated in the manual, this will not cut really thick, coarse grasses. Best for regular lawn grass and clover, or other lawn weeds. But this is NOT a quiet machine. It will make noise. Plus, some little dogs might be scared of it, so get ready for barking! My mini-dachshund thinks it’s some lawn monster. This little machine brings back memories for me, plus it’s nice exercise. So pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rita D. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on Bermuda despite warning in instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was very easy and required no tools at all. The instructions said reel mowers don't work well on Bermuda grass, but I have Bermuda and this mower cuts through it pretty easily as long as I don't let the grass get too long. Pushing a reel mower was slightly more work than I thought, but not bad at all, and I actually enjoy cutting the grass. I live in Houston and we cut the grass pretty much year round, and I plan to use this for a long time. Very happy, it's a solid mower.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leifker

customer_reviews.title: GO GREEN!!  ....and get some exercise!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase! I'm basically done with gas-powered mowers - the maintenance, the repairs, the upkeep, etc...... This lawnmower does a great job and it's a great way to just "zone out", put on some headphones and listen to music, books, or podcasts, and get your chores done. The lawn always looks wonderful after I'm done with it.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and (mostly )effective
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and (mostly )effective. It's light enough that you can cut the grass without breaking a sweat. It is not very effective against nut sedge, which is a bit frustrating. Between the blades and the wheels, there tends to be grass that gets wrapped on the axel. Given the location, it can be rather difficult to remove. It's nice and quiet and I'm not afraid of mowing when the dogs are in the yard. Overall this is an easy and safe mower to use.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: I also had an issue where a piece broke off of the device rendering it useless. The company was quick to send a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I think my wife purchased this thing to punish me. Ive tried several times to lower the blade in order to cut my grass a little lower but this has been problematic. I may be doing something wrong but its no where near as intuitive as a gas mower. I also had an issue where a piece broke off of the device rendering it useless. The company was quick to send a replacement, a brand new mower in fact. However, if I could do it all over again, I would avoid angering my wife and purchase a gas or electric mower for my small yard.
customer_reviews.author: N.S. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: Missing pieces ! Can’t put together. No way to contact
customer_reviews.author: fancy

customer_reviews.title: but it did not cut my grass good at all
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed to be made fairly well, but it did not cut my grass good at all. I have a very small yard so I thought this would be a perfect fit. My grass is not very thick and was maybe 4 inches long when I received this. I had to take about 5 passes down the same path and there was still grass that would not cut. It seems to work for some people but did not for me. I went with a gas-powered snapper which works incredibly well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Old Fashion Mower for the price
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday 7/24/17. Easy assembly. Mowed my lawn. Glad I have a small yard. Grass was a little long so I will mow again in 2 or 3 days to even it up. Bought this as a back up mower for my expensive battery operated mower. This mower did a good job and takes a little elbow grease to push it through the lawn. Instructions explain adjustments for raising and lowering the blades and how to adjust the tension. Like I said, glad I have a small yard. Recommended this to a friend of mine. 4 stars because I don't love it but I like it a lot for the price and was pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have only grass (and no twigs)
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a few months but kept getting little branches stuck in it and it wouldn't work. Would have to pick t up and shake them out. Then it just got so annoying picking it up all the time. So if you have no trees and just grass it would be perfect. Otherwise would recommend a weed whacker
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mower!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this sooner! We have 10 acres, but the grass pathways between our raised beds are too narrow for the monster mower to cut. For a long time, I ended up cutting all that grass with a string trimmer which is incredibly time consuming and tiring on the arms. This lovely mower assembled in a flash and trims the grass with a satisfying 'snip-snip-snip" at a speed that allows the toads and other small creatures to get out of my way without harm. I'm not a big person, but I have no trouble at all pushing this mower, even on inclines. I would absolutely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: New England Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great little mower!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little mower. It is lightweight, gets in corners that our riding lawnmower can't reach. It is able to even mow down taller grass, though it may take a run or two. Sometimes, little twigs will get stuck, but it has also gone right over sticks that I thought would be stuck. I walk everyday at the mall, so I appreciate being able to get more exercise by doing something so simple as mowing. Oh and the adjustment height is also easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: pit bull fan

customer_reviews.title: Effective arm workout! Cuts grass too!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I was hesitant at first to order but after seeing some of the reviews I decided to get it. I'm giving it 4 right because I was missing a small part that came with it (which doesn't hinder the use) but it's a cap on the handle. Also it's not very user friendly to assemble, but it gets the job done. we have a small yard and it cuts the grass pretty well. Just make sure to clean off any dirt or grass so it doesn't rust. It definitely works your arms muscles pushing it around!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Small lightweight unit doing exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20 foot by 70 foot dog run were cutting the grass was problematic due to the high fencing and impossibility of getting my lawn tractor in. Cutting with a weed wacker was difficult. I knew I needed a push lawn mower such as I had used as a child (I'm 78) but could not find any ten and five years ago. Have a new dog so looked again and suddenly the environment/health movement has reawakened the demand for push mowers! This one was very easy to assemble (basically putting the handle on), cuts very well and now the grass in the dog run is well maintained. Sawyer (labrador retriever) and I are both happy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Anyway once we got the second put together it's worked so great. I love that I can push it around ...
customer_reviews.text: The first package came and after we'd almost assembled it we realized it was missing a piece! (One of the push handles haha) so we got in touch with Amazon and got a new one sent; sent the other whole thing back. I guess it had a hole in the box and the handle had fallen out. Anyway once we got the second put together it's worked so great. I love that I can push it around the yard even when my kids are playing and I get a good little workout. Keep the wheels and axles oiled and you're good to go! (Don't leave it out in the rain or cut the grass when it's wet)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I have a smallish lawn and I was finding it harder to pull the rope to start my gas mower. This mower is light weight and easy to push. It cuts the grass well, but if you have a tall weed you might have to go over it a couple of times. I dont have many weeds (plantains). I would recommend this for any older folks that enjoy mowing but dont like gas mowers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Digirolamo

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy but works good
customer_reviews.text: Spent some time to assemble cause I want to adjust the height of cutting to the maximum. I had never mowed before so it also took me some time to figure out how it works. The whole mowing process is smooth except I feel it heavy to lift it and turn around (My weight is 105lbs). Given it’s eco-friendly, I will accept this tiny drawback and I will see if I would get used to that during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: 1 year Update: another reviewer penned it perfectly writing "This is great exercise, but if you're like me and you don't have a perfect lawn, then maybe its not the tool for you. It cannot cut crab grass or other tougher weeds". First review: So far so good, easy to put together. I wish the wing nuts were actual nuts instead of part of the screw, but it works well and was a good price. I'll update this review if any problems arise and/or after I've owned it a year.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Effective, Satisfying and Compact
customer_reviews.text: Cuts grass like a dream, very satisfying to use. If you like shorter grass, you may have to go over the spot a couple of times. Perfect for small lawns, or patches of lawn where a homeowner doesn't need to invest in a power mower or where one won't fit. Absolutely does not cut weeds, just flattens them. You will need a weed wacker if you have a weed problem. Easy to assemble - the e-clip that secures the handle to the mower requires a bit of force to click in. You will need gloves or a towel to protect your hands. Light enough for me to maneuver and I'm short.
customer_reviews.author: Dryheat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid to even try to assemble the mower for fear I would slice my finger off or just be plain incompetent. Neither occurred. The directions were great, and I was all smiles less than an hour later. I’m sure it could have been done faster, but I am not mechanically inclined so I took it slow and watched some YouTube videos as well before beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Better off using safety scissors
customer_reviews.text: I let my husband try this against my better judgement. After mowing a quarter of the yard he gave up. Grass constantly gets stuck in the blades and it has to be taken out by hand. Blades are sharp if you have little hands nearby. And the result? A lawn that looks like an angry toddler hacked at it with safety scissors. Don’t do this to yourself!
customer_reviews.author: McYa

customer_reviews.title: Hey, it works!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and used it for the first time. I've got 324 sq ft of yard and it's totally appropriate for that. Assembly went well and I only needed tools for adjusting the blades (a screwdriver). At first I thought I was bogus, then realised you need to spend a few minutes adjusting the blades and blade guard thing to get a cut. After that, super. Takes a few passes, and I made sure to rake first. All in all, this is exactly what I wanted, and it cut my grass great.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES E LEMAY

customer_reviews.title: and a string trimmer doesn't give nice enough results
customer_reviews.text: I planted about 300 square feet of sod on the inside of a circular drive that has a stone wall surrounding it. Too difficult to lift a gas powered mower over the walls, and a string trimmer doesn't give nice enough results. This mower is the answer. High quality, sharp blades, works perfectly, and gives a really nice cut. Would not recommend if there is any debris, as even the tiniest sticks will jam the mower.
customer_reviews.author: Dewster

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well and easy to maneuver!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small push mower for my dog pen and other areas I can't maneuver the ride on mower into, and this is just the ticket. It went together easily and is plenty sharp. I have used it twice and it's a piece of cake. The price is fair, the quality is solid and I get a bit of exercise to boot. Win-win. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: whatareyoulookinat

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assemble. It cuts grass better than I expected, including broadleaf weeds. It does not cut dandelion flower stems however. Required maintenance is merely to lightly oil the blades after use. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase. We'll just see how the mower stands up over time.
customer_reviews.author: James Williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut it
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much, but the results are underwhelming to say the least. Unless you have really fine grass in a perfectly level yard, don't buy this. I did my best with this thing and the grass is a chopped up mess, uneven, with the weeds left standing. I had to go over and over it to even make it look like it was cut. Maybe the blades aren't sharp or heavy enough. The "old time" push mowers did the job, but this thing just doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: The guy who shares our duplex and I split the cost as we share mowing resposibilities. This thing works great. It's a lot more labor intensive than a gas mower, but I feel it does a superior job. Longer grass may require a couple passes. I highly recomend that you pick all sticks out of your yard before mowing with this as the smallest stick will stop it in it's tracks. The best thing is it's super quiet. I can get out and mow really early in the morning before it gets too hot and start mowing and not be in violation of our towns noise ordnances.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joe Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Great at cutting short grass. No need for gas or smelling exhaust anymore. Warning, these types of mowers are not made for long grass. If I happen to run over a few long strands, they will still be there when I am finished. The trend today is to leave the grass longer (for many reasons), so this may not be the type of mower for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I am 5'4" and 110 pounds and I can easily push this thing through my yard. It does get my heart rate up, so it is somewhat of a workout, but it is much easier to use than I anticipated. I attacked my feet tall overgrown weed yard and this did a darn good job. some weeds slip through and are hard to mow evenly, but it does a great job on grass and low weeds. I put it together myself and it was really simple. I am really happy with this purchase, such a nice alternative to power mowers.
customer_reviews.author: Orangevelvet

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment, but a little tough to operate on an imperfect lawn
customer_reviews.text: For small yards, this has been a pretty good solution to owning a motorized lawn mower and maintaining it. I like that I don't have to fire up a gas engine just to keep the lawn nice-looking. I would note: my yard is currently not in great shape. It has more weed-type grasses than regular, those are a bit harder for this mower to handle. I wouldn't recommend going to a reel mower unless your yard is in pretty good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor S Ericson

customer_reviews.title: Good for grass, not weeds...
customer_reviews.text: The mower works fine. Unfortunately the house I bought has more weeds than grass in the yard. This mower was not able to cut the stalks of one of the more prolific type of weed because they are quite tough. They're also tall so my yard looked unkempt all the time. I broke down and bought a gas powered mower. But I'm keeping this mower for the day when I have killed off those darn weeds and have a yard of actual grass to mow!
customer_reviews.author: PsychOut

customer_reviews.title: Great eco friendly product
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this quality wise, its well made and not flimsy when you use it. The handle is very sturdy and ergonomic, it feels comfortable. Is not too hard to push and its easy to roll. Pros: it is USA made, which was a big concern to me, I bought the blade sharpening kit and its very easy to maintain. Doesn't use gas, its quiet and doesn't make loud exhaust sounds. It is easy to store and doesn't use a ton of space. Cons, it only works on fairly short grass, it does not cut tall grass so you really have to keep up with it. Otherwise, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy.C.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This manual lawn mower mows the lawn's grass and weeds. Recommend multiple short, "forward and back" mows instead of trying to go the full length of the lawn in one push. Great for core exercise, since the gym is closed due to Covid-19.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great for my newly seeded lawn!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time getting my soil just right for the seed and didn't want a heavy gas mower gouging ruts in the soft dirt. Enter the reel mower...light weight, easy to assemble, and a dream to use. Cuts the grass like scissors, with a precise clean edge. The roller on the back allows me to get STRIPES on this new grass. My lawn has never been the envy of the block before...but it is now. I am now a huge fan of reel mowers!
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my small yard
customer_reviews.text: I used this mower for a few years and really appreciated the build quality and the cut. I've recently started usingwhich I find far less pleasant to use, but it does have the one advantage of a slightly higher cutting height (I'm trying to keep the grass longer to use less water). Anyway, this worked great for years before needing to be resharpened. I still miss the solid construction when using the Scott's mower.
customer_reviews.author: C. Matheson

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to maneuver. Not easy to assemble; not light weight. It does cut the grass, but I have to back over certain spots with a weed eater. Also stops even if a small stick gets caught in the blades. I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Howard

customer_reviews.title: Only way to get a 1/2" cut
customer_reviews.text: Manual lawn mowers like these are the only way to get a 1/2" cut like a golf course fairway... For the price this is unbeatable. Planted Bermuda grass seeds and my lawn is smooth as the golf course
customer_reviews.author: WJG

customer_reviews.title: (Revised from 2 star review) Now 4 star.
customer_reviews.text: When Reel Mower arrived the cutting blade was not adjusted properly so it was constantly jamming and was more of a pain in the ass than I thought it was worth. However, after leaving the previous review and a lengthy break from mowing I decided to back the blade cut bracket end off and give it another go. It didn't seem to cut consistently but was at least usable. On the last mowing, I adjusted the blade clearance closer and it is now working very well. Because I feel much better about the product, I'm changing my review to like. Advice to manufacture would be to better QA the product to avoid a negative review.
customer_reviews.author: Googleplex Industries

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This item was pretty easy to assemble. It was a bit difficult and took a lot of my woman power to get the handle onto the blade shaft or unit.(not sure how to phrase that) I lowered it to the lowest possible cutting. I wish it would cut a bit better, but over all I’m satisfied with it. I have a very small patch of lawn, so it serves the purpose. Everything else was a 5 star. It’s not heavy but not super light.
customer_reviews.author: gina lamour

customer_reviews.title: Spins easily, Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model because wanted the smallest footprint for storing in our small garage and because I wanted the highest cutting height I could get. We have a small ~12x35' grassy area so pushing this around that little bit is no problem. I'm very happy with this one. It is very sturdy and cuts the grass with ease. I'd buy this same model again.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS MOWER. easy to use and cuts the lawn great. can have some difficulty if trying to tackle tall stalky grass as it tends to just bend them over but gets everything else
customer_reviews.author: horsey

customer_reviews.title: Purchased June 2016 Still Mowing
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of use. I only have 1/8 of an acre and it takes me less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly S.

customer_reviews.title: Had my doubt but I'm extremely happy with this mower.
customer_reviews.text: I had some concerns about how well it would slice through our Texas grass but this thing did not disappoint. I had some areas of weeds that I honestly thought this mower would not be able to cut through, I was wrong. DESTROYED THEM. Very easy to assemble and the blade is well designed and sturdy. Fits well in garage only taking up a few feet due to it's design. Only issue I've had if you can call it that is the wing nuts that secure the handle together. Sometimes they come loose while mowing or moving but is a quick fix with just a couple of twists with your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: T-Med

customer_reviews.title: Great mower.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year and it works extremely well for the lawn I have which is about 1/8 of an acre total that needs regular mowing. I am 5'4" and it is very easy for me to use. Someone that is taller might find it bothers their back as it does my son whose 6'5". But I highly recommend this for anyone that wants to be environmental conscientious and equally important not have to worry about buying gasoline (and storing) or dealing with a cord or charger.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Works great, stores easily
customer_reviews.text: This is my first reel mower, and I have to say, I am very impressed! Thing works incredibly well with very little effort. I just bought my first home, and do not have a shed, so this thing tucks away in my enclosed back porch nicely. Plus, I don't have to worry about gas, and troubleshooting the way I would with a gas mower. Just going to ditch the shed idea and keep this guy long term.
customer_reviews.author: Clueless Wallob

customer_reviews.title: It is not a bad product - it is just did not work for ...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning it. It is not a bad product - it is just did not work for our type of grass - I have carpet thick Zoysia grass on my yard and despite my husbands attempts to adjust the mower - it was very hard to push and and it would not cut the grass. I had a small strip next to the street where we have Bermuda grass and over there this lawn mower was performing pretty well. So, out of my experience, I would recommend this tool for small evenly shaped yards with thin grass but coarse grass.
customer_reviews.author: S. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Fun for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Great to "just hit the front yard real quick" when I get home. Really enjoy watching blades fling up cut blades of grass from the whirring blades. No gas!!!!!!!! Frequently takes two passes though to get a clean cut comparable to my Honda gas mower. This is especially true when the grass is long enough to start laying down as it just pushes down in front of mower and springs back up behind. If your yard takes less than 20 minutes with a glass mower this is a great way to go. Bigger like mine it makes a better supplement.
customer_reviews.author: titaniumcooker

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with ease
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long this mower is great. Was easy to assemble is so lightweight and does a wonderful job. I was holding g into my old mower thinking if it ain’t broke
customer_reviews.author: Ramona A. Milburn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small-medium sized yards.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it twice so far and have been pleased with it. You can adjust the length of grass needed to be mowed (slightly cumbersome but no big deal). Very easy to store etc. It also gives you a work out while mowing the because you have to “push” it.
customer_reviews.author: Masood Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Mower is old school which is best school
customer_reviews.text: Love the convenience and quality of the mower. The downside of the mower is that everyone who passes by is curious and wants to stop you to ask what you think of the “old school mower” or to ask if this is “The Cleaver residence”. (I ask the nostalgic Leave It To Beaver interrupters to provide some of June’s lemonade or else take their wisecracks to Lumpy’s.;)
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy G

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I’ve been mowing my lawn for years with a gas mower and decided to give this a try. I absolutely loved it. Yes, it doesn’t cut through certain weeds but I have no trouble going back thru the yard with the weed trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mower since last summer and am very impressed with it. As a short, older woman I was concerned it might not work for me, but it is great. Easy to push through my grass and it is quiet, so I can mow early in the morning without disturbing the neighbors. I have a lot of weeds in some areas and can mow them unless they get too long or too thick. Small sticks may cause the blades to jam but small price to pay for eco-friendly mowing.
customer_reviews.author: CJColorado

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my wife in shape
customer_reviews.text: My wife pushes this almost daily while our infant is strapped to her in a baby backpack. The neighbors think we're crazy but my wife really worked off the baby weight this way. Bonus: quiet enough to let me sleep. Also, eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah J. Timmins

customer_reviews.title: You get some exercise, you do some good for the environment and you get your grass cut!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting a lot, but this a really good quality mower. I checked out some other mowers at local hardware and big box stores and ordered this one primarily for the price, but when it arrived and I assembled it was please to see that it was actually much sturdier than some mowers that were priced significantly higher that I would have had to lug home instead of having it delivered right to my door. Cuts the grass to a nice length. This does a very nice job, you get a little exercise and you do something good for the environment. How can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Noel S.

customer_reviews.title: and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It's surprisingly light, inexpensive, and easy to assemble. It's great for the environment and using it gives you a nice sweat, but it does not work well on long grass and cuts a tad uneven, but if you keep your lawn short, it's a low fuss way to regularly maintain your lawn because you quickly learn that if you don't, using this tool won't work well once your grass or in my case weeds grows too long.
customer_reviews.author: Alt Kagesa

customer_reviews.title: it's better to cut the grass while it's short.
customer_reviews.text: It will cut grass very well but if it's tall grass it won't cut at all and you will have to run over it like 50 times. But it's superb for short grass.
customer_reviews.author: Stealth tree 9000

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble. I put it together and then mowed my smallish yard. Yes: the smallest twig will stop the mowing action. Clear the blockage and continue. Yes! This worked on my wonky, uneven, pitted lawn due to the large wheels. Yes: some weeds escaped cutting. I am not maniacal about the state of my lawn so this didn't bother me at all. No noise pollution, no horrible gas smell, and a great work out.
customer_reviews.author: CindyK.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I own this exact same lawn mower, purchased roughly 20 years ago. After all this time, it has performed well, but it was time to retire it. The lawn mower just purchased will be lucky to last 2 years, due to the cheapness of construction and materials used. The handle grips are uncomfortable, the handle flexes during use, the reel doesn't turn easily, and the wheels are irritatingly out of round. I'm sorry I bought it, and will not purchase any lawn mower made or sold by this company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Heine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a reel mower but kept being talked out of it by all the jaded men who remembered pushing their father's rusted one around their 5 acre yard. (For some reason the yard kept getting bigger and bigger as they talked.) This works fine for my small yard. No, it doesn't do well on tall grass or weeds but does well once the yard is under control. Light-weight and makes the sweetest sound when used. Only issue I had with it is the bar along the base sometimes makes it difficult to maneuver when moving.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great Push lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: Light weight almost effortless push mower. Easy to use almost self propelled. Less effort than a push power mower. Only drawback it don’t pick up leaves but cutting grass is a breeze. Highly recommended. Will I buy another one! Defently if and when the one I have fails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy quality as older previous Great States mowers The handles should be made of heavier ...
customer_reviews.text: Won't say it's junk, things just aren't made the way they used to be in the USA. For a Reel push lawnmower it works adequately and as expected. Not as heavy quality as older previous Great States mowers The handles should be made of heavier gauge steel to give it less flex. The whole mechanism needs to be heavier weight to keep the wheels turning on the grass. Not my Grandma's reel lawnmower but good for $82
customer_reviews.author: Shadowbirdie

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My yard is mixed with weeds and other grasses. The first run through mostly always require a second with the tougher weeds. Also I noticed that the edge of the blade could stand to be a about an 1/8 inch long on eat side to cover more surface area between the wheels. I was debating on whether or not to return it because I do have a fairly large area to mow because as I mentioned you have to run a second pass each time. I do enjoy the workout and NOT being a slave to the gas mower, it seems to be holding up ok so I'll most likely keep it, for $85 it's a value.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Stanton

customer_reviews.title: so it keeps it nice and neat
customer_reviews.text: I grew up loving to watch my GrandPa use his lawnmower and watch in amasement as those sharp blades spun quickly & effeciently to cut the grass! He had a HUGE yard and did it all by hand! So, since we only have a small backyard with a deck and then a narrow side yard and front I suggested we get one to use in between when the lawn service comes. We live in Florida, so it keeps it nice and neat. It arrived promptly, easy to assemble and works great! We even got our 10 year old excited to cut the grass!!!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Michele Evans

customer_reviews.title: ... keep your grass mowed down this thing is as easy as any push mower
customer_reviews.text: As long as you keep your grass mowed down this thing is as easy as any push mower. If your grass is taller than the entrance to the blades it will just push it over. I now twice a week now and it's as easy as walking around the yard
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Myrick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mower!
customer_reviews.text: Had this mower for almost 3 months now. Everyone made fun of me for getting it and not using a gas mower. This thing does an amazing job!!! You may have to go over spots slow or a couple times but you have to do the same thing with a gas mower from time to time. But the best part is how even and clean your grass looks. Looks way better than a gas mower in my opinion. Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: N S

customer_reviews.title: I really like this mower
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really like this mower. Unfortunately, my grass grows really quickly and what I really need is a hand mower that cuts longer grass and leaves it around 3-4 inches instead of 2.5. If the grass is longer, this just flattens it. But since that doesn't exist, this one works nicely. It is hard if you get a lot of twigs in your yard, which I do, so I have to keep stopping to pull out the twigs. I ordered the grass catcher, so hoping that keeps the lawn neater without the cutting all over it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Functional
customer_reviews.text: In fact it puts the fun back into fun-ctional equipment. What I like best about this is that if you go really fast it sounds like a spaceship of some kind. Also, people have complained that long grass or twigs will stop it up, but those people don't have any quad strength to push through. With a running start, this mower could cut through chicken bones, no problem. Another cool thing is that it is quiet and you look like an old school bad-ass gardener pushing one of these around. Plus, no gas required, the only fuel you need is food.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great States mower.
customer_reviews.text: This a great mower! I have a fairly small oddly shaped front lawn that I simply could not maneuver our big clunky gas mower well to do a credible job of mowing. This is perfect. Cuts well, easy to maneuver. I did mow when when lawn was slightly wet. Still very good with the exception of snowfall ranges weeds that just bent over a nd did not know down real well. No problem though w h enough lawn was dry. Love my mower!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Minner

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for a three year old.
customer_reviews.text: Even my three year old can push this thing over bermuda grass. Child labor, I'm shocked! Relax, he insists on doing it...under close supervision. "I try. I try." "Okay. We don't touch the blades." "Don't touch the blades," he agrees. See? CPS not required.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: The work
customer_reviews.text: it's really a good tool, not so difficult to manage and you can give the quick cut to your grass without crazy effort... Not need of gas or electric stuff, this is the most Eco Sustainable tool
customer_reviews.author: D. Carbonera

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! After going through 2 lawn mowers in five ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! After going through 2 lawn mowers in five years, I decided to try this thing. Simply put; it gets the job done. With a little extra elbow grease I was able to do my back yard which hadn't been mowed in about 3.5 weeks due to my old broken mower. The blades come already extremely sharp and setup took me about 10 minutes. If you have a small yard, get this thing! You'll never have to worry about gas, oil, smoke, noise, etc. again. This is a great deal for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: Solid little unit for the price. If you have a small to medium patch of grass to tend, this is a great solution. Doesn't fill the neighborhood with fumes or noise. And obviously doesn't take up much space, either.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great States, Great Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard, and I love this lawn mower. Yes, it is smaller than a comparable gas mower so you have to do more trips back and forth. Yes, it misses blades of grass here and there. If you want your lawn to look like the greens at Augusta, get something else. If you believe a beautiful lawn is not about perfection, but rather about nature and protecting nature and clean air and actually using your muscles? Well, the choice is pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolnir. PMA

customer_reviews.title: If your not a perfectionist this is perfect
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble and use. Pushing it was little effort. I have Bermuda grass which was about 10in long. It did good but a lot of long pieces left with a bunch of grass left laying down. Will update review after next cut.
customer_reviews.author: brewerfamily

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. My finace was the one who actually made ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. My finace was the one who actually made this purchase and I was rather skeptical. I mean, how well can a reel mower cut? I have been thoroughly impressed. This mower cuts our yard with ease. Some skinny weeds do sneak through the blades, but not enough to notice unless you're really looking for it (which I was). This mower leaves our yard looking completely different that when we were using a regular gas push mower. It leaves the grass looking fuller. I was a skeptic, but I was really impressed with this mower.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Not made in America, bad instructions, but a good mower
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the name fool you, it's all just marketing hype. This mower is made in China, the build quality is "meh", the instructions are "meh" (for example, they clearly tell you *EXACTLY* the incorrect way of assembling the product)... but it does mow well. I wouldn't be surprised if this is a throw away after a few years seeing that it's not a high-quality mower (just a "meh" quality), but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: S. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Cuts grass and is simple enough to use
customer_reviews.text: It cuts quite well and is easy enough to put together and adjust the blades. The only reason I won't give it a perfect rating is because one of the wheels won't turn when the mower is bring dragged backwards, which is the recommended way of moving the mower when not cutting grass. Otherwise it seems to work fine!
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in relatively longer grass
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in relatively longer grass. We used it initially to cut the lawn while we over seeded and parched some bare spots (can't use a mower for at least a month). I'm considering using it as a greener option and for good exercise ongoing. Exceeds expectations (the grass catcher accessory broke our first time but a replacement is on its way and will arrive well ahead of the next mowing) Fairly easy to put together and adjust the height, even the grass catcher accessory we also purchased was a few minutes install tops. Time will tell if it holds up with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: This would be great for someone without the tree problem
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to be hip and green and also save money by getting this instead of a gas mower for my small yard. I probably could be all those things if I didn't have a gigantic tree hurling twigs and branches all over the place. Alas, now I'm hip, green, saving money, and frustrated with having to constantly stop to pull various tree parts out of the blade. This would be great for someone without the tree problem. It's otherwise quite easy to use on a relatively flat yard, and cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now that I have the Reel Mower I actually enjoy mowing the yard
customer_reviews.text: I live in the city so my yard isn't that big maybe 40 x 25 feet. I've been using a weedeater for 15 years. Now that I have the Reel Mower I actually enjoy mowing the yard. It's fun and easy. All the other reviews are correct about the sticks getting stuck in the blades but I don't mind. I just back it up, remove the stick and keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Gregtheleo

product_meta.title: Great States 415-16 16-Inch 5-Blade Push Reel Lawn Mower, 16-Inch, 5-Blade, Silver
product_meta.description:
Make mowing the lawn feel easier and more efficient with the Great States 16" 5-Blade Push Reel Lawn Mower. The Great States manual push hand reel rotary mower is easy to assemble and, more importantly, allows you to keep your lawn looking neat and trim without making too much noise and bothering your neighbors. You can move the lawn push manual hand mower around with ease, because the handles are comfortable on your hands. Quiet operation and zero carbon emissions make owning a manual push hand reel lawn mower an easy choice.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The power source behind our mowers hasn't changed much in 100 years. It's still readily available on demand. You can still fuel it for the price of a banana and a glass of milk. It always works when you want it to, and it doesn't leave any residue for the environment to absorb other than a couple of foot prints in a perfectly cut lawn. People- the power behind our mowers in 1895, and the power behind them today. What has changed is the product available to the people. At Great States, we've applied a century of technology to a good old fashioned idea: the reel lawn mower. Today's reel mowers are lightweight and easy to maneuver. They're ideal for today's smaller lawns, and today's hectic lifestyles. They're always ready when you're ready, and they're almost maintenance free with no spark plugs to foul or engines to clog up. They're good to the environment and they're good to the lawn, snipping the grass for a clean, precise cut. A cut that's helped us carve our niche as the nation's largest manufacturer of in-demand, on-demand reel mowers. We've spent 100 years of perfecting our reel mower designs, streamlining our production processes and searching for the best possible materials to build the best reel mowers possible. And we're proud of all that. But more important still, we've spent the last 100 years, and we'll spend the next 100 more, keeping America Green. Great States 16-inch cutting width reel lawn mower. 4 spider 5 blade with ball bearing reel. 2-inch welded shrub bar. 10-inch ball bearing wheels. Easy height adjustment of 1/2-inch to 2-1/2-inch.
feature_bullets: Manual push reel lawn mower features quick, adjustable cutting height of 0. 5"-2. 5" for a clean, even cut every time
16" cutting width, 5-blade ball bearing reel, and 10" composite wheels make using this manual hand push reel lawn mower easy
Blades of the manual hand push reel lawn mower are made of quality, heat-treated alloy steel for staying sharp longer
T-style handle with cushioned grip and lightweight design for comfort when using this manual hand push reel lawn mower; Easy, tool-less assembly
Clean and quiet way to maintain your lawn; Great States manual hand push rotary reel lawn mower requires no gas or oil

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,202 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
